incidents.name: Scenario Execution Delays

incident_updates.body:
Earlier this evening, between 7:40 PM and 8:00 PM CEST, we experienced an issue that caused delays in scenario executions in the zone eu1.make.celonis.com. 

This has now been fully resolved, and all systems are operating normally. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

incidents.name: Notification Email Delivery Failure for Failed Scenarios & Paused Organizations

incident_updates.body: We have successfully resolved the issue with the email notifications on us1.make.com and the zone is fully operational.
The fix has been implemented, and we've confirmed that the impact on email notifications on us1.make.com has been alleviated. We're continuing to monitor the situation.
We are currently investigating an issue that prevents the sending of notification emails about failed scenarios and paused organizations.
We are currently investigating an issue that prevents the sending of notification emails about failed scenarios and paused organizations.

incidents.name: Global Platform Degradation

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

For the official statement and more details on this incident, please visit the following page:

https://help.make.com/alert-an-outage-may-have-impacted-your-scenario-execution-on-4-september-2025

The incident remains under active monitoring. We are now in the process of reactivating the scenarios that may have been deactivated during this incident. We recommend that all users verify the operational status of their own scenarios.
We have restored functionality across all our zones. We are currently monitoring the situation and addressing any minor issues as they arise.
Functionality has been restored on eu2.make.com and us1.make.celonis.com. We're working on restoring the remaining zones and will post an update within the next 30 minutes.
We've identified the issues and restored the login page for make.com. We're now working to restore full functionality across all zones and will update you on our progress within the next 30 minutes.

Our engineering team continues to investigate the issue impacting all zones. We are treating this as top priority and are working around the clock to identify the root cause.  
We will keep you informed and share updates as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineering team is continuing to investigate the root cause of the issue affecting all zones.

We are actively working to restore full functionality as quickly as possible. We will provide the next update within 30 minutes, or sooner if new information becomes available.

We are currently experiencing issues across all zones. Users may encounter Bad Gateway errors and be unable to access the platform or execute scenarios successfully. Our team is actively investigating the cause, and we will provide an update within the next 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Degraded performance on US1 enterprise zone (us1.make.celonis.com)

incident_updates.body:
The degraded performance issue in our US1 enterprise zone (us1.make.celonis.com) has been resolved.
The service was impacted between 6:05 PM and 6:32 PM.
We will continue to monitor the platform to ensure stability.

incidents.name: Failing modules/executions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The incident has been stabilized and we are monitoring the zones. We have also identified that other zones was also affected

eu1.make.com
eu2.make.com
us1.make.com
us2.make.com
eu1.make.celonis.com
us1.make.celonis.com

Scenarios running on the US zones might have faced errors with some modules hitting time outs. The situation is stable now.
The incident is still active. We are actively investigating and working on the issue. We will provide another update within the next hour.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented
We are currently investigating an issue where scenarios executions are being affected. Some modules might return error during the executions.

incidents.name: Issues with payments and subscriptions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved
We have identified the issue and implemented a fix. We will continue monitoring the service before we consider this fully resolved.
We are observing issues with our payment processing services. There might be potential issues with payments and subscriptions. This issue affects all our zones. Scenario processing is not affected.

incidents.name: AI agents not working on EU2 and US2 zones

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved
A fix has been verified on our testing environment and rolled out to affected zones. We will keep monitoring this issue before it's considered fully fixed.
We have prepared a fix and are currently testing it before deploying it to affected zones. We will update again in 30min.
We have identified the root cause and working on a fix. We will update again in 30min.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue. We will update again no later than in next 30min.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue. We will update again no later than in next 30min.
We have identified an issue with the AI Agents service and working with the engineering team to fix it.

We are observing issues with AI Agents on EU2 and US2 zones. The feature is not operational right now.
We are looking into this and will provide update in no more than 30min.

incidents.name: Service disruption of monday.com API

incident_updates.body: This incident has now been resolved by the monday.com team. The monday.com integration and webhooks are operational on all zones.
A fix has been implemented by the monday.com team. The integration is now operational but it may still experience some latency. Our engineering team is closely monitoring the situation.

The monday.com team is working to resolve the issue on the US and EU servers. The AUS server is fully operational.

For more information, please visit the monday.com status page https://status.monday.com/.

We are currently experiencing a service disruption affecting features connected to our monday.com integration. This is due to a major API outage from monday.com, which their team is actively investigating as the root cause.

Our own systems remain fully operational, but functionality including scenarios and webhooks that relying on data from monday.com is currently degraded. Our engineering team is closely monitoring the situation.

For more information, please visit the monday.com status page https://status.monday.com/.

components.name: us1.make.celonis.com
components.description:
The previous notification regarding an outage in this zone was posted in error. This was caused by human error during a manual status update.
We can confirm that the zone was, and remains, fully operational, with no actual impact on services.
The status indicator on our page has been corrected. We sincerely apologize for any confusion this may have caused.

incidents.name: monday.com - intermittent errors

incident_updates.body: Reported problem with monday.com errors was resolved with no further impact on users and their scenario runs.

This incident has been resolved. Our investigation confirmed the root cause was unexpected breaking changes introduced by monday.com to their 2024-10 API.
Our integration relies on this specific version, which is not deprecated and should therefore not receive breaking changes. We have deployed a hotfix to accommodate these changes, and service has been restored. We will continue to monitor the platform closely.

We have identified the problem of monday.com API causing these intermittent errors and we are working on resolving this as soon as possible. We are in touch with monday.com team to cooperate on solving this issue.

We are currently investigating an issue causing intermittent errors with monday.com integration. Our team is working to identify the cause and restore normal operations as quickly as possible. We will provide another update as soon as we have more information.

We are actively working on fix

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

make.com public page was not accessible from 15:03 - 15:18 CET, users might encountered problems using the platform, login page and community pages stayed functional. The root cause was found and fixed. We are currently monitoring the issue.

incidents.name: us1.make.com zone unstable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

us1.make.com zone was unstable today from 10:53 - 11:02 CET. Users might have encountered login issues, webhook delays, and missing email notifications. The issue is no longer present, Make app is accessible and functional. We are currently monitoring the issue.

Thank you for your patience while we have been investigating this issue.
Incident is now marked as resolved.

We are currently investigating the issue and the reasons for getting following error on certain leads resulting in error - Unsupported get request. 

Thank you for your patience while we continue working with Meta to investigate and resolve this issue.

incidents.name: Google Auth is facing issues in US

incident_updates.body:
Fix of the issue was confirmed by Google.

Google statement:
The issue has been mitigated for all affected users as of 2025-07-18 08:56 US/Pacific.
A subset of workspace customers experienced elevated latency and error rates using workspace services.
Our initial investigation points to a hardware infrastructure failure as the likely cause. Engineers have mitigated the workspace impact by routing the traffic away from the affected hardware infrastructure.

Our monitoring indicates that the Google authentication issue has been resolved, and scenarios are now being executed without timeouts and delays.
We will keep monitoring the platform.

Google Auth is facing issues at the moment preventing users relying on this authentication method to log in. We advise users not to logout or you may not be able to log in again while the incident is active.
This is causing scenario execution timing out.
Customers in EU and US zone might be affected.
For detail check the Google workspace status page:
https://www.google.com/appsstatus/dashboard/incidents/oFcAZTr4EVieF5Fr6Ee9

incidents.name: The "Make for Google Sheets" add-on is currently unavailable on Google Workspace Marketplace

incident_updates.body: We are finalizing approval of Make add-on for Google Sheets and will inform all users via standard communication way by email once published and ready for use.
We are finalizing final remarks based on Google feedback in order to get an approval of marketplace add-on. Available workaround is documented and available - https://apps.make.com/google-sheets.
We are working on approval of marketplace add-on with Google team. Available workaround is documented and available - https://apps.make.com/google-sheets.
We keep awaiting approval from Google about our Google Sheets marketplace add-on verification.
We are continuously working with Google verification team to approve our Google Cloud Project and Google Sheets add-on.
We are working on review of new add-on for Google Sheets together with Google team.
We have shared deployment instructions for the workaround with users and are actively working on a permanent solution.
We've identified a workaround and will provide users with clear instructions on how to proceed shortly.
Our team is currently investigating the issue and working on restoring the add-on as soon as possible.

New certificate has been deployed.  We are monitoring the status.

We are aware that the SSL certificate for next.integromat.com has expired, causing accessibility issues. Users are unable to login via Google OAUTH

incidents.name: Facebook Lead Ads - "New Lead" module data

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting the "Facebook Leads Ads - New Lead" module has been resolved. Leads are being fetched correctly. For customers impacted during the affected period (Monday, 27 January, 3:00 pm CET - Tuesday, 28 January, 12:30 pm CET), we will be sending out detailed email instructions on how to manually retrieve any missing leads using the "Watch Leads" module. We apologize for the inconvenience this may have caused.

We identified the root cause of the issue in our infrastructure and have taken steps to mitigate it. Leads were not reliably delivered in the period of Monday 27 January 3:00 pm CET - Tuesday 28 January 12:30 pm CET. According to our telemetry, fetching of new leads using the Facebook Leads Ads - New Lead module is now working correctly. Leads that were not delivered during the affected period will not be automatically redelivered and users will need to fetch the data from Facebook Leads Ads manually, using the Watch Leads module. Users who have contacted our Customer Support team have been informed about the workaround. We continue monitoring the situation.

We experience issues with the "Facebook Leads Ads - New Lead" module, not fetching new lead correctly. Our dev team is investigating the issue together with Meta team. However, it seems to be caused by Meta API problems, as users across various platforms are reporting the same issue in their community.
As of now, we do not have an estimated time for resolution, and we regret any inconvenience this issue may cause.

incident_updates.body: We've identified the issue and successfully delivered a hotfix stabilizing the Google Drive upload. The incident is now resolved.

We're actively investigating the issue and have identified that it originates on Google's side. We're in contact with their team to understand why we're being blocked and working together to resolve it as quickly as possible.

We're facing issues with the Google Drive module, particularly with file uploads. While some uploads may work partially with empty files, they're still causing scenarios to fail. We'll keep you updated as the day progresses.
